TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ServiceDescriptionImportStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the import is made to the server or to the client computer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An import made to the client computer generates a proxy class with synchronous and asynchronous methods to invoke each method within an XML Web service. A server import, on the other hand, generates an abstract class with abstract members, which you must override to provide the implementation you need.
## Examples [!code-cpp[ServiceDescriptionImportStyle_Client#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_46_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ServiceDescriptionImportStyle_Client#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.de_46_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ServiceDescriptionImportStyle_Client#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_46_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle Client = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the import should be made to the client computer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle Server = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the import should be made to the server.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle ServerInterface = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the import should be made to a server interface.
